src:
Princesa dala pretepsti delavca?
Savdska princesa Hasa bint Salman naj bi varnostniku naročila, naj se moškemu maščuje. Posumila je, da je delavec, ki je prenavljal njeno stanovanje, na skrivaj fotografiral.
02 Nov 2019, 15:13 by B. K. P.



REUTERSPrincesa Hasa je sestra Mohameda bin Salmana. FOTO: REUTERS



Emmanuel Moyne je princesin zagovornik.


Savdski princesi Hasi bint Salman v Franciji sodijo, sicer v njeni odsotnosti, zaradi očitkov o napeljevanju k ugrabitvi in napadu na enega od zaposlenih.


Emmanuel Moyne je princesin zagovornik.

Svojemu telesnemu stražarju naj bi namreč naročila, naj pretepe delavca, ki je leta 2016 prenavljal njeno pariško stanovanje. Princesin francoski odvetnik je tamkajšnjim medijem dejal, da Hasa bint Salman, sestra savdskega princa Mohameda, vse očitke zanika, češ da ni sodelovala pri nobenem ob navedenih dejanj.Novembra 2017 je Francija za princeso izdala mednarodni nalog za prijetje, a je na sodišče niso pripeljali, je pa sodnik kljub temu sprožil sojenje, ki pa bo potekalo v njeni odsotnosti. Princesa Hasa naj bi se delavcu z imenom Ashraf Eid hotela maščevati, saj ga je sumila, da je naskrivaj fotografiral stanovanje, ki ga je prenavljal.Nikdar ne bi storila reči, s katero bi škodovala drugemu človeškemu bitju.Obtožila ga je, da namerava fotografijo prodati, nato naj bi mu, tako je policiji povedal Eid, eden njenih varnostnikov zvezal roki ter ga večkrat udaril s pestmi ter za nameček še obrcal. Ko ga je moški pretepal, naj bi mu princesa zabrusila: »Boš že videl, kako se govori s princeso, kako se govori s kraljevo družino.«Svojemu telesnemu stražarju pa je menda dejala, naj ga kar ubije. Vse to je Hasin zagovornik Emmanuel Moyne na sodišču zanikal, češ da je princesa v svoji deželi znana po svojem človekoljubnem delu in »nikdar ne bi storila reči, s katero bi škodovala drugemu človeškemu bitju«. Na zatožno klop bo moral sesti tudi varnostnik, a tudi on vse očitke zanika.
text:
Princess gave a beating to a worker?
Saudi princess Hasa bint Salman has ordered the security guard to take revenge on the man. She suspected that the employee renovating her apartment had been secretly photographed.
02 Nov 2019, 15:13 by B. K. P.



REUTERSPrincess Hass is Mohammed bin Salman's sister. PHOTO: REUTERS



Emmanuel Moyne is a princess advocate.


Saudi princesses Hasi bint Salman in France are being tried, in her absence, for allegations of abduction and assault on one of their employees.


Emmanuel Moyne is a princess advocate.

She allegedly ordered her bodyguard to beat up a worker who renovated her Paris apartment in 2016. The Princess's French lawyer told the local media that Hasa bint Salman, sister of Saudi Prince Mohammed, denies all the allegations that she had not participated in any of the above actions. , however, the judge did initiate a trial, which will be held in her absence. Princess Hass allegedly wanted a revenge worker named Ashraf Eid on suspicion of secretly photographing an apartment he was renovating. She would never do any harm to another human being. to sell, then, as Eid told police, one of her security guards clasped his hands and repeatedly hit him with his fists and turned him over. When he was beaten by a man, the princess allegedly blurted out to him, "You will already see him talking to the princess, talking to the royal family." But she told her bodyguard to kill him. All this has been denied in court by Hasina's advocate Emmanuel Moyne, claiming that the princess in her land is known for her philanthropic work and "would never do anything to harm another human being." A security guard will also have to sit on the bench, but he also denies any allegations.
